BBKSDA Riau Terima Laporan Kemunculan Harimau Sumatera
03 Nov 2019, 18:38 by Chaidir Anwar Tanjung
Pekanbaru - Harimau Sumatera liar muncul di sekitaran Taman Nasional (TN) Zamrud, Riau. Kemunculannya harimau itu membuat heboh pekerja di sekitaran kawasan Zamrud.
"Bebarapa hari ini BBKSDA (Balai Besar Konservasi Sumber Daya Alam) Riau menerima laporan adanya kemunculan harimau Sumatera di Taman Nasional Zamrud," kata Kepala BBKSDA Riau, Suharyono kepada wartawan, Minggu (3/11/2019).
Haryono menjelaskan sudah dua kali mendapatkan laporan kemunculan harimau. Kemunculan pertama pada 25 Oktober 2019, kemunculan kedua pada 1 November.
"Harimau itu muncul kembali di lokasi yang sama. Dia ada di Km 23 yang ada di Taman Nasional Zamrud," katanya.
Atas kemunculan harimau ini, Haryono menyebut pihaknya telah berkoordinasi dengan Badan Operasi Bersama (BOB). Ia mengimbau agar masyarakat tenang dan tidak panik.
"Secara umum kita berharap agar masyarakat tenang, jangan panik, dan tidak mengambil langkah-langkah yang merugikan kelestarian satwa harimau ini," katanya.
Haryono juga mengatakan pihaknya akan segera memasang tanda-tanda yang kemungkinan telah dilintasi harimau. Ia juga akan melakukan operasi pencarian harimau itu.
"Kita juga akan melakukan operasi sapu jerat di lokasi," pungkasnya.

BBKSDA Riau Receive Reports of Sumatran Tiger Emergence
03 Nov 2019, 18:38 by Chaidir Anwar Tanjung
Pekanbaru - Wild Sumatran tigers appear around the Zamrud National Park (TN), Riau. The appearance of the tiger made a scene of workers around the Emerald area.
"How come today the BBKSDA (Riau Center for Conservation of Natural Resources) received a report of the appearance of the Sumatran tiger in the Emerald National Park," Riau BBKSDA Head Suharyono told reporters on Sunday (3/11/2019).
Haryono explained that he had twice received reports of tiger appearances. First appearance on October 25, 2019, second appearance on November 1.
"The tiger reappeared at the same location. He was at Km 23 in the Emerald National Park," he said.
Upon the emergence of this tiger, Haryono said it had coordinated with the Joint Operations Agency (BOB). He appealed for people to be calm and not panic.
"In general we hope that the community will be calm, don't panic, and not take steps that are detrimental to the preservation of these tiger animals," he said.
Haryono also said that his party would soon install signs that the tiger might have crossed. He will also carry out a search operation for the tiger.
"We will also carry out a broom trap operation at the location," he concluded.
